intro: Orbea wissmannii, commonly known as the Wissmann's orbea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and clusters of bright orange or yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves and stems. It produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Orbea wissmannii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience.
